content.description:
Petis ut tibi avunculi mei exitum scribam, quo verius 
tradere posterisposteri, -orum, m. pl.: future generations possis. Gratias ago; nam video morti eius si 
celebretur a te immortalem gloriam esse propositampropono, -ere, -posui, -positum: to promise. 
Quamvis enim pulcherrimarum cladeclades, -is, f. = casus, -us terrarum, ut populi ut 

urbes memorabilimemorabilis, -e, adj.: memorable casu, quasi semper victurus occiderit, 
quamvis ipse plurima opera et mansura condiderit, multum 
tamen perpetuitatiperpetuitas, -tatis, f.: permanence eius scriptorum tuorum aeternitasaeternitas, -tatis, f.: immortality addet. 
Equidem beatos puto, quibus deorum munere datum est aut 
facere scribenda aut scribere legenda, beatissimos vero 

quibus utrumque. Horum in numero avunculus meus et suis 
libris et tuis erit.
content.question: How is Horum in numero avunculus meus et suis libris et tuis erit (lines 10-11) translated?

choices.label: My uncle will be among the number of these people by means of both his and your books.
My uncle will be in a number of these books—both because of their writings and yours.
My uncle has a number of these books—both those men’s and your own.
My uncle has his own and your own books in great number.

content.answer: My uncle will be among the number of these people by means of both his and your books.

unit.text: 2: Pliny's Letters: Eruption of Mt. Vesuvius
